summary: The Disaster Relief for Farm Workers Act amends the Food, Agriculture, Conservation, and Trade Act of 1990 to provide emergency assistance to farm workers affected by covered disasters. The Secretary of Agriculture will award grants to eligible farm worker organizations to provide relief, including direct financial aid, capacity building, infrastructure support, and emergency services. Covered disasters include adverse weather events, health crises, and other events causing income loss or work disruption. Eligible organizations are farm worker membership groups or 501(c)(3) organizations with experience in supporting farm workers.
